source.title: Concurrent activation of striatal direct and indirect pathways during action initiation

confidence_rationale: Strong boundary evidence that action-initiation and suppression channels can be coactive, weakening strict separability assumptions.

mapping.source_claim_statement: Direct and indirect striatal pathways can activate concurrently around action initiation.
mapping.ree_translation: Mixed for MECH-026: vigilance-related inhibition is plausible, but action and restraint channels are partly overlapping and dynamically coupled.
mapping.mapping_caveat: Concurrent pathway activity is measured in specific movement contexts and does not fully resolve cognitive vigilance semantics.
mapping.source_context: In vivo pathway recordings during movement initiation.

confidence_components.notes: Critical disconfirming boundary for over-clean loop separation.
